channel.title: Player abuse
channel.description:
pi 317
So lately this guy has been changing his ip and making new accounts to drop starter gold :(
How could I make it so you cannot drop for 30 minutes?
If anyone could help that would be greatly appreciated!

item.title: Player abuse
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Death Style:

just curious how would the server know your mac address

Most people send the mac address when you first login. I’ve seen it in a few.
There are a couple out there (Silab mentioned one in a thread) that will request the mac address only when they’re going to use it in a punishment.
But I’m pretty sure the client sends it over… So that part of the client code could also be modified to send not your mac address.

item.title: Player abuse
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:9, topic:551958”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=670875.msg4486268#msg4486268 date=1434137311]

If you really want to prevent it, get people’s MAC addresses and the log their starters using that.

rofl
[/quote]
yep…[/quote]
IP addresses are easy to change, as clearly stated by the OP…
MAC addresses, while still modifiable, are not as easy (For general users).
And considering a lot of servers use MAC addresses for banning, why would they not use it for a starter?

You tell me another system that they could use to prevent the starter from being traded that’s not (Or does not use):
A timer (Trade/stake/drop whatever).
Tracking the user by account name.
Tracking the user by IP address.
Tracking the user by UID.

That generally eliminates most things you could do.
So take your rofls elsewhere, and help the person.

item.title: Player abuse
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Bowser jr:

Don’t give your players a significant amount of starter gold, that will prevent people from abusing it. A time limit is too easy to bypass.

This.

Trade timers. Or any kind of “Starter timer” will turn players away from servers. I know because I’ve personally quit because of one.

If you really want to prevent it, get people’s MAC addresses and the log their starters using that.
Or you could generate a unique ID and save it to their cache (using the client) and then you can send that ID to the server and use that…
As most people won’t be smart enough to look in the cache for a uid (You could even make it look like it’s a model or something by hiding it in a folder like /models/r/UID_HERE.dat).

Read full topic

Tell them that it is blocked for 1/user. Do not block them from doing it on the same connection. Then make use of the autoban when users try to abuse it =P Call it a honeypot of sorts…
